attributes.action: Educate Children on Dog Handling as part of Primary Education
attributes.additional_details:
Research from Australia shows that the most notorious breed under the dangerous dogs act (the American Pit Bull Terrier) only expresses a 1% probability of showing aggression to a human or and other animal.

Dog aggression is a handler issue rather than a breed issue.

Taking funds used to implement breed specific law and channelling it into the education of young children will not only teach children how to approach a dog safely, but will raise a new generation of more able and responsible dog owners.

Make Dog Handling and Awareness a compulsory part of primary and secondary education
